title: England players furious after claims Bulgaria coach Krasimir Balakov told them racist abuse is 'normal'
text:
England players were furious that Bulgaria coach Krasimir Balakov allegedly told them “this is normal” as they complained about the racist abuse that almost saw the Euro 2020 qualifying game abandoned.

And Gareth Southgate’s squad came to a collective decision to make Bulgaria “suffer” by playing on, rather than staging a walk-off.

The match in Sofia was stopped twice because of racism and, on the second occasion just before half-time, England players, including Keiran Trippier and Jordan Henderson, could be seen exchanging words with Balakov. Henderson chose not to reveal the details of the conversation after the game, but sources close to the row have alleged that Balakov had attempted to tell England’s players there was nothing to get upset about.

Balakov claimed after the game that he had not heard any racist chanting on the touchline and that would seemingly tally with what he is believed to have said to England’s players. As they spoke with referee Ivan Bebek and the Uefa delegate about the monkey chanting coming from the stands, England players believe Balakov told them: “What is wrong? This is normal.”

That sent some members of Southgate’s squad into a rage and Henderson said: “I obviously wasn't happy with the situation that we were in, it wasn't nice to be involved in and it shouldn't be happening in 2019, it is very disappointing.

“But, at the same time, I felt as though as a team we dealt with it so well, we touched on it before we came here just in case it did happen and unfortunately it did.

“So we spoke together and the decision was that we carried on because if you leave the pitch and stop the game they win, really.

“That is how we looked at it, it is what the message was in the dressing room at half-time and we wanted to go out in the second half and make them suffer and make their team suffer on the pitch, and I think we did that.”
description: England players were furious that Bulgaria coach Krasimir Balakov allegedly told them “this is normal” as they complained about the racist abuse that almost saw the Euro 2020 qualifying game abandoned.
